Posts.Content:
Thanks! I had an MRI, but they scheduled one without contrast. Grrr. The test was pretty much pointless. They didn't see anything. No duh!
They said they aren't doing anything else. Just wait and watch. It's been there for months.... What do they think is going to happen? Don't think much will change.
They said maybe it's bone inflammation?! Doesn't make sense. 
Trying to get a second opinion at another breast center.
Posts.Title: Painless lump. Doctor doesn't know what it is.

Posts.Content: My cardiologist also called me today because she wants to do a second heart surgery. UGH

Posts.Content: I know how you feel, sort of. I went to the top breast center in my area and they left me very disappointed. I'm so frustrated with how they are handling my situation. I have a palpable lump and they can't even tell me what it is. UGHH
Posts.Title: Multiple/excessive films for no reason

Posts.Content: It's so frustrating. I don't know how an ultrasound can't find it but everyone can feel it by touch. I feel like giving up on finding out what it is.
Posts.Title: Painless lump. Doctor doesn't know what it is.

Posts.Content: So I had a breast MRI scheduled for yesterday and got a call in the morning that another doctor had cancelled the MRI for me because it was not necessary. My pcp ordered the test because she felt that it WAS necessary. I'm not sure how they can do that. So now my pcp is sending me for a regular chest MRI, not a breast one, since they aren't cooperating. I feel like I'm pulling a tooth, to simply get further evaluation for a very obvious lump. My dad's side had breast cancer.

Posts.Content: When do you have the biopsy?
Posts.Title: Painless lump. Doctor doesn't know what it is.

Posts.Content: I'm 28 and I've had a painless lump that is visible and can be felt at the top of my right breast for months. It's hard, doesn't feel like I can move it, and won't go away. Got sent to have an ultrasound that didn't show anything, at all. Everyone in the room felt it easily but couldn't see it in imaging. Doc said she didn't know what it was but could be a injury to my rib. It doesn't hurt though?!?! She didn't suggest anything else and now I'm more confused than before.
Posts.Title: Painless lump. Doctor doesn't know what it is.

Posts.Content:
Thank you. I'm worried that they didn't see it because of my dense tissue. I hear about
 people like you, who had imaging that missed it, and I feel like I should explore for a second opinion. Doctor says it's not showing up, (only one test has been done) so I shouldn't worry.
Posts.Title: Painless lump. Doctor doesn't know what it is.

Posts.Content: Yeah, they told me the same. I had an X-ray today to see if it was bone related (pointless) and nothing showed except scarring on my lung? I've got my PCP sending me for a MRI finally. Don't know if it'll help but maybe ask for an MRI? I've heard they can see things ultrasounds can't.
